result.execSummary:
The defendant Adisa M Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***CLARIFICATION to sentencing of 08-25-2014; Count one (1) is consecutive to any other sentence.***
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and supervision fees, including the costs and surcharges ordered in Count 2. Should defendant get revoked, Court ordered monies taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor

No contact with the victim, Ms. Brenda R., whatsoever, in person by phone or by third parties.
No contact with the Mount Mary College located at 2900 North Menomonee River Parkway, City of Glendale, County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No controlled substances or alcohol.

Provide a DNA sample.
Urine screens.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Undergo a mental health evaluation; follow thru with any treatment recommended.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

timeConds.notes: Good time and release to Day Reporting Center
30 days condition time for contempt of court; NO good time, however, release for Day Reporting Center allowed

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, plus costs, while on probation/prison in Count 1

Defendant Adisa M Reed in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Adisa M Reed in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called, passed and recalled.  Parties advise the Court that they have reached a resolution on this case.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss the "use of a dangerous weapon" penalty enhancer.  Court granted State's motion and ordered the penalty enhancer dismissed.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court vacated the 8/25/14 jury trial date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties still negotiating; State tendered a new offer.  Defense counsel requested a short adjournment; no objection by the State.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties' request for another final pre-trial date and motion hearing  was granted by the Court, who allowed negotiations to remain open until that date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.  Case remains calendared for final pre-trial before Branch 20.
Motion for Bail Modification received and filed.  Parties notified and case set for bail review in Branch 20 on 07/18/2014 at 8:30am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements Under Miranda/Goodchild, received and filed.
Pretrial scheduling order signed and filed.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  The following filing schedule was set:  movant must file by 7/07/14; response due by 7/17/14; reply due by 7/22/14.  All motions in limine, witness lists and jury instructions are to be filed within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 6/24/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 20.

Defendant Adisa M Reed in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Adisa M Reed in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs more time for negotiations and for investigation. Court grants the defense request to adjourn the jury trial. Branch 15 does not have any available trial dates prior to rotation.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.
for Modification of Bail, received and filed. sab

Defendant Adisa M Reed in court with attorney Thomas J Kasen.  Defendant Adisa M Reed in custody.  William Levins for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants defense attorney request to withdraw as counsel.  Email sent to PD office for appointment of counsel.  Jury Trial scheduled on 06/25/2014 is NOT vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15 for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/30/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/25/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Thomas J Kasen in court, defendant Adisa M Reed not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests additional time.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Adisa M Reed in court with attorney Thomas J Kasen.  Defendant Adisa M Reed in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brenda R or Mount Mary College

Defendant Adisa M Reed in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Adisa M Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
